author: Gus_263
title: Warrior of the air
review: Lewa is back with an new armor in 2008. His new color is awesome but i like more the old green color. The gray color is also an new color for him, but he is so much gray. His lime green pieces uses an new plastic, like all the Phantoka, making the pieces more strong. His mask looks like the Lesovikk's mask, but is better with some designs and size. The Midak blaster is another feature and shoots easily but is heavy for some sets. His saber is the best weapon for green new bionicles, and his pieces on his arm´s top can be used easily to make an warrior of the air, due to it looks like some jetpacks. An great feature is the possibility to "team up" with the Matoran Tanma set, in a simple and good system. I rate Lewa Phantoka 5/5.

author: webkinz19
title: Cool set
review: I got this in sumer.It had lots of cool stuff like a cool mask and weapens.                                                                                                                                                                                                                Good set!

author: Aleiobot
title: Didn't get the original, but I got the new!
review:
I don't have the original Toa Lewa, but I got the new one! I've almost completed my 2008 collection and this is definitely one of the coolest Toa! The double jet packs and shoulder blades are interestingly cool features. His sword is massive and possibly the coolest sword design I've seen on Bionicles. If you don't own this set, you must have it before they're gone! Below are some pros. Sorry, but there are no cons!

Pros: cool new 2008 pieces
        midak skyblaster that really fires
        matoran can ride on Lewa's back!
        sweet aerodynamic mask!
        massively cool sword

author: legoguy_3000_
title: My first Phantoka
review:
A very good set.  This was my first phantoka and the midak skyblaster was better than I thought it was.  

pros:

midak skyblaster really fires

green eyes

you can combine it with Toa Lewa, Antroz and Tanma to make Spiriah. If you want to get spiriah I'll just do a tiny review of him:

Makuta spiriah isn't a very good combo.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: He's dangerously close to being my favorite Phantoka...
review:
But no, Vamprah definitely takes first.  But, I mean, c'mon!  Second place is nice!!
Toa Lewa is totally new in this new version, and the new features are amazing.  I love, just absolutely DIG, those jetpacks on his shoulders, and I like how he joins up with Tanma.  His sword is big and really dangerous-looking, and the Midak Skyblaster is nice, too, shooting SILVER Zamors!  My only complaint is that his feet kinda look buggy (Karzahni has the same type).

Pros:

JETPACKS!!

Midak Skyblaster is new and good

Sword looks dangerous (even has some lightning zapping around inside!)

He's HUGE!!  (compared to the old one)

Mask of Levitation is cool looking

Cons:

Feet look "buggy"

Go get Toa Lewa before he's gone!!

author: Carl
title: Lewa is back!
review:
This is going to be a short review. So, pros and cons:

Pros:
Awesome mask
Midak Sky-blaster is AWESOME!
Jets on side of arms
Sweet sword
Cool chest plate
Tall
Can team up with Tanma for even more awesomeness

Cons:
Grey not silver
Hooks on arms limit posability

author: knuclear200x
title: My First True-Love...Bionicle
review:
I first saw this on display at a Lego retail store. I had to get this guy:

Pros:
Look at that helmet. I think this is the first and only one I've seen that doesn't have "angry eyes" and it's wide-eyes certainly does attract. Other awesome features include the spike-jetpack-shoulders and the green/gray color combo is good too. And instead of some specific action-feature, it just comes with a sword. Personally, I haven't grown very fond of action features from previous lines as they sometimes affect poseability and appearance.

Cons:
The shoulder-spikes get in the way of the arm poseability a little. And...well...that's it.

Overall:
With only one minor flaw, cool weapons and accessories this is truly a Bionicle worth picking for ten bucks (plus tax).

author: Danblom
title: Lawa Returns
review:
It's nice to see you back!  Lewa, though many pronounce his name wrong, is a classic Bionical icon, and I'm glad Lego brought him back.  But to the point;

Pro:
*Sleek Body
*Sweet Sky Blaster
*Great Mask-Good eyecolor/mask cordnation
*Ausome Sorwd

Cons:
*None that come to mind...

Great set!

author: smasher
title: The Awesome Toa Of Air!
review:
Toa Lewa Nuva(Adaptive Armor) is one of the most awesome sets of 2008. He has a long electrifying sword along with two rocket boosters on his arms. I must complain that his legs are extremely thin. The Midak Skyblaster is not really such a big deal as his arms support its weight. Combined with Tanma is much better for playability. Anyways 5/5, get this set in anyway you can.

-Smasher

author: TangDynasty
title: One of our favourite Bionicle
review:
After getting Tanma, we got to have Toa Lewa! It was truly an awesome sight when the 2 of them combine!

 

We enjoyed building it and some of the parts were nice. He is tall compare to the other Bionicle and for us, he is perhaps the best amongst the Phantoka series.

 

Pros

- Nice colour scheme, lime green and grey

- Cool mask with visor

- Huge sword

- Skyblaster

- Tall and good proportion

 

Cons

- Can't think of any

 

Overall, we love this set. We have the rest of the Phantoka series but this to me is the one to get.

 

Thanks for reading!

author: Toa_Haprik
title: Team Up & Buy
review: i just built this from my bionicle collection and boy the phantoka were brilliant and i love lewa it is good because the colours , and parts and it is worth the money!! & i already had tanma ready built so overall 5/5

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Phantoka) - Toa Lewa Review
review:
This is a cool figure to have and it's fun to play with as well. The build is very nice and easy and we also don't have to worry about stickers. The arms, the legs, the feet, the hands and the head can sviwel and on one hand you can see a cool looking sword and on the other hand you can see a cool cannon. You're able to put in 4 balls into the cannon and it shoots very well. On each shoulder you can also find a jet-pack which is always a great piece to have. I also like the lime green colors on Lewa. On his back you can see a piece which is able to attach a matoran figure from this theme (for example: set 8944 - Tanma). As I told you in the beginning: It's a fun set to have - even for pieces which you can use for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure.

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: blaksamu12
title: Strongest form of Lewa
review:
A very cool set.  I got Lewa Nuva Phantoka complete with canister and instructions on ebay for only $4!  His build is very standard, much like Inika builds.  His back part that connects to Tanma, the matoran (that I dont have :() is really cool.  His color scheme changed from his original Mata and Nuva forms, but is identical to the Lewa that comes with Axalara.  His rare feet make him very tall, and his shoulder armor is super cool.  His long sword is a great addition, and the Midak Skyblaster suprisingly doesn't weigh his down and fits well with the set.  His mask is EPIC.  The blue piece oober awesome.  Overall, I suggest getting him on ebay for $12 or less.  He's easily the best of Phantoka, so I only got him.  9/10, because of the heavy amount of gray in the color scheme and because of the price. 

 

:{)
